Simulate a Study with Multiple Prey Initial Conditions

simulate_study.Rd

This function performs simulations for a study based on varying initial prey counts. It uses a provided model and parameters to generate simulation results and combines these results into a single dataframe.

Usage

simulate_study(data, time_max, model, parameters)

Arguments

data

A dataframe containing the study parameters. It must include the following columns:

  • prey_initial: An integer indicating the initial density of prey.

  • n_replicates: An integer specifying the number of replicates for each prey_initial.

time_max

A positive numeric value specifying the maximum time for the simulation.

model

A function representing the model to be used in the simulation.

parameters

A list of parameters to be passed to the model function.

Value

A dataframe containing the simulation results.

Details

The function first validates the inputs to ensure they meet the required specifications. It then iterates over unique values of initial prey density, performs simulations for each value, and combines all results into a single dataframe.

If the dataframe has more than one row per unique prey_initial value or if any other input validations fail, the function will stop with an error message.

Examples

# Example usage (assuming appropriate model and parameters):
data <- data.frame(n_prey_initial = c(10, 20, 30), n_replicates = c(100, 100, 100))
time_max <- 10
model <- model_constant_rate()
parameters <- list(rate = 0.1)
result <- simulate_study(data, time_max, model, parameters)
